prompt_0:
The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about high school microeconomics.

In a competitive labor market for housepainters, which of the following would increase the demand for housepainters?
A. An effective minimum wage imposed on this labor market.
B. An increase in the price of gallons of paint.
C. An increase in the construction of new houses.
D. An increase in the price of mechanical painters so long as the output effect exceeds the substitution effect.
Answer: C

If the government subsidizes producers in a perfectly competitive market, then
A. the demand for the product will increase
B. the demand for the product will decrease
C. the consumer surplus will increase
D. the consumer surplus will decrease
Answer: C

The concentration ratio for a monopoly is
A. 0
B. 5
C. 10
D. 100
Answer: D

Which of the following is true of a price floor?
A. The price floor shifts the demand curve to the left.
B. An effective floor creates a shortage of the good.
C. The price floor shifts the supply curve of the good to the right.
D. To be an effective floor, it must be set above the equilibrium price.
Answer: D

Which of the following is necessarily a characteristic of oligopoly?
A. Free entry into and exit from the market
B. A few large producers
C. One producer of a good with no close substitutes
D. A homogenous product
Answer: B

Which of the following is NOT a source of wage differentials?
A. Differences in human capital stock.
B. Racial or gender discrimination.
C. Immobility of workers.
D. Decrease in the birth rate.
Answer: A

B. An effective floor creates a shortage of the good.
C. The price floor shifts the supply curve of the good to the right.
D. To be an effective floor, it must be set above the equilibrium price.
Answer: D

Which of the following is necessarily a characteristic of oligopoly?
A. Free entry into and exit from the market
B. A few large producers
C. One producer of a good with no close substitutes
D. A homogenous product
Answer: B

If firms are entering an industry that is monopolistically competitive, we would expect
A. the demand for existing firms to shift rightward.
B. the market price of the product to increase.
C. the demand for existing firms to become more inelastic.
D. the demand for existing firms to shift leftward.
Answer: C

B. An upward shift in MPL.
C. A downward shift in ATC.
D. An upward shift in MC.
Answer: A
prompt_1:
The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about high school microeconomics.

In a competitive labor market for housepainters, which of the following would increase the demand for housepainters?
A. An effective minimum wage imposed on this labor market.
B. An increase in the price of gallons of paint.
C. An increase in the construction of new houses.
D. An increase in the price of mechanical painters so long as the output effect exceeds the substitution effect.
Answer: C

If the government subsidizes producers in a perfectly competitive market, then
A. the demand for the product will increase
B. the demand for the product will decrease
C. the consumer surplus will increase
D. the consumer surplus will decrease
Answer: C

The concentration ratio for a monopoly is
A. 0
B. 5
C. 10
D. 100
Answer: D

Which of the following is true of a price floor?
A. The price floor shifts the demand curve to the left.
B. An effective floor creates a shortage of the good.
C. The price floor shifts the supply curve of the good to the right.
D. To be an effective floor, it must be set above the equilibrium price.
Answer: D

Which of the following is necessarily a characteristic of oligopoly?
A. Free entry into and exit from the market
B. A few large producers
C. One producer of a good with no close substitutes
D. A homogenous product
Answer: B

A. An upward shift in AFC.

Answer: B

Answer: D

A. An effective minimum wage imposed on this labor market.
B. An increase in the price of gallons of paint.
C. An increase in the construction of new houses.
D. An increase in the price of mechanical painters so long as the output effect exceeds the substitution effect.
Answer: C

If the government subsidizes producers in a perfectly competitive market, then
A. the demand for the product will increase
B. the demand for the product will decrease
C. the consumer surplus will increase
D. the consumer surplus will decrease
Answer: C

The concentration ratio for a monopoly is
A. 0
B. 5
C. 10
D. 100
Answer: D

Which of the following is true of a price floor?
A. The price floor shifts the demand curve to the left.
B. An effective floor creates a shortage of the good.
C. The price floor shifts the supply curve of the good to the right.
D. To be an effective floor, it must be set above the equilibrium price.
Answer: D

Which of the following is necessarily a characteristic of oligopoly?
A. Free entry into and exit from the market
B. A few large producers
C. One producer of a good with no close substitutes
D. A homogenous product
Answer: B

If the government wishes to regulate a natural monopoly so that it produces an allocatively efficient level of output, it would be at an output
A. where price is equal to average total cost.
B. where marginal revenue equals marginal cost.
C. where normal profits are made.
D. where price is equal to marginal cost.
Answer: A

A. An effective minimum wage imposed on this labor market.
B. An increase in the price of gallons of paint.
C. An increase in the construction of new houses.
D. An increase in the price of mechanical painters so long as the output effect exceeds the substitution effect.
Answer: C

If the government subsidizes producers in a perfectly competitive market, then
A. the demand for the product will increase
B. the demand for the product will decrease
C. the consumer surplus will increase
D. the consumer surplus will decrease
Answer: C

The concentration ratio for a monopoly is
A. 0
B. 5
C. 10
D. 100
Answer: D

Which of the following is true of a price floor?
A. The price floor shifts the demand curve to the left.
B. An effective floor creates a shortage of the good.
C. The price floor shifts the supply curve of the good to the right.
D. To be an effective floor, it must be set above the equilibrium price.
Answer: D

Which of the following is necessarily a characteristic of oligopoly?
A. Free entry into and exit from the market
B. A few large producers
C. One producer of a good with no close substitutes
D. A homogenous product
Answer: B

Because people with relatively low incomes spend a larger percentage of their income on food than people with relatively high incomes, a sales tax on food would fall into which category of taxes?
A. Progressive
B. Proportional
C. Regressive
D. Neutral
Answer: D

In a competitive labor market for housepainters, which of the following would increase the demand for housepainters?
A. An effective minimum wage imposed on this labor market.
B. An increase in the price of gallons of paint.
C. An increase in the construction of new houses.
D. An increase in the price of mechanical painters so long as the output effect exceeds the substitution effect.
Answer: C

If the government subsidizes producers in a perfectly competitive market, then
A. the demand for the product will increase
B. the demand for the product will decrease
C. the consumer surplus will increase
D. the consumer surplus will decrease
Answer: C

The concentration ratio for a monopoly is
A. 0
B. 5
C. 10
D. 100
Answer: D

Which of the following is true of a price floor?
A. The price floor shifts the demand curve to the left.
B. An effective floor creates a shortage of the good.
C. The price floor shifts the supply curve of the good to the right.
D. To be an effective floor, it must be set above the equilibrium price.
Answer: D

Which of the following is necessarily a characteristic of oligopoly?
A. Free entry into and exit from the market
B. A few large producers
C. One producer of a good with no close substitutes
D. A homogenous product
Answer: B

A competitive market for coffee, a normal good, is currently in equilibrium. Which of the following would most likely result in an increase in the demand for coffee?
A. Consumer income falls.
B. The price of tea rises.
C. The wage of coffee plantation workers falls.
D. Technology in the harvesting of coffee beans improves.
Answer: C

A. P or wage rate of labor > MRP of labor and with one additional unit of labor, wage rate < MRP.
